We've kept it for now. Thinking about framing it! Not sure if you read my previous comments but I was cleaning the space to create a music venue and we've built a theme around the 'Mummy Cat'.
The poor fella looks like he had a great personality... I mean, just look at that pose.
You got it.
Nope. Just a dry undisturbed space. Pretty wild. Pretty scary to come across this guy.

Thanks for the thoughts. It was a dry/old shed. Most likely undisturbed for at least 3-5 years, maybe more.
We cleared out the space to make a DIY music venue. We had our first show last night and decided to call the space Mummy Cat Lounge.
I know, it's nuts. It looks like it died while striking a pose.

WRITING.TEXT: !Remindme one week

Very envious of you. I, unfortunately, only came across his work today.. I went on a deep dive (4 hours..or more) into his music and was completely blown away. I listen to a few tracks and was hooked then started reading more about him... The first track I listened to after I read about his death was "Coward". It really hit me hard. Wish I would have known about his music sooner.
Totally agree. Jab is a soundscape mastermind.

S-town is some of the best audio I've heard in a while. I can only imagine the amount of editing that went into that project. The podcast was produced by the incredible folks from This American Life and Serial.
Damn.. wish I saw this earlier.
Blind folded.
I work in management and play in a band. Also very interested in music tech. Where are you based?

Have you reviewed Amazon's "review guidelines"? I'm curious if your review was indeed in conflict with Amazon's policy?
I know this is irrelevant to your point but you should protest against Amazon for rejecting your review.
If your goal is to see this policy revised, then push to make that happen. I would argue that one of the first steps of making this change would be to be sure that review remains on Amazon's marketplace.
Good luck, --
